reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a two night package which included a pick up from the airport and the trip to Wagah Border (4 hours round trip by taxi) which was very good value. The room and bathroom were clean. Our only complaint was about the bed linen, it looked like the duvet cover hadn't been changed. We asked them to change it but not sure that they did. The restaurant is more like a cafeteria and breakfast was basic. Staff were friendly and helpful. The location was great for the Golden Temple , we were able to visit several times. Rooms on the front are very noisy. Not our favourite hotel on our visit to India but acceptable.
reviews.title: Good Hotel in Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only stayed 1 night. The staff, though not super professional, was very helpful. Great location for Golden Temple. Room showed some wear, but the bed was by far the most comfortable of our 2 weeks in India. Would stay again. As others have said, get a back room unless you like street noise.
reviews.title: Fit the bill nicely

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a two night package at this hotel, primarily as a base to visit the nearby Golden Temple. As such it was a good choice and the package, including the unmissable trip to the border closing ceremony, was certeinly good value. However, the hotel staff had little knowledge of the package deal and had to be prompted to fulfil their part of the bargain. The hotel restaurant is mediocre, the coffee undrinkable. Fortunately there is a decent restaurant across the road and a couple of other good ones nearby to save the day. The room was actually quite nice, clean and well furnished...the rooms at the back of the hotel are best to avoid busy street noise.
reviews.title: Good location for Golden Temple ..but some problems.

reviews.text: You may wish to make several visits to the GT and so this hotel is ideally placed, being only about 5 mins walk away.
reviews.title: Ideal Location

reviews.text: The Hotel was fine from start to finish. It's a modern hotel but it is ideal for this non tourist city.
reviews.title: Fantastic in every way

likes.disliked: — views from the rooms and street noise

reviews.text: This hotel has a very good location, the rates seem reasonable too but more than that, it is a very clean place. The pictures we saw on the internet prior to the booking were not misleading at all. We visited Amritsar in 2008 Nov too, but stayed in a different hotel which was really bad. Hotel City Heart came as a pleasant surprise, and we would not hesitate to stay here in the future or recommend it to our friends
reviews.title: Execellent location and service

reviews.text: This is a small family run type hotel in the center of Amritsar. They kept to their word regarding booking (which was done by email without credit card). Helped when we need to change pound to rupees (and gave a decent rate). Basically pretty good.
reviews.title: Small clean hotel. Central. Convinenant. Food mediocre but otherwise excellent.

reviews.text: The best part of thing was the flexibility with which you could visit the Golden temple a couple of minutes by walk.
reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE, LOCATION, CLEAN, AND BEAUTIFULLY KEPT HOTEL!!!!

reviews.text: The only downsides were some of the rooms were a little dark decor wise and the food was slow and not upto Amritsar standards.
reviews.title: Good Clean place & very good service and food

likes.liked: — Cleanliness and proximity to the Golden temple

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This Hotel was in the perfect location to visit any part of Amritsar. I stayed in Hotel City Heart once a week for 4 months. This hotel has the best service I have received at any hotel which I have stayed at in all of India. The service was Phenomenal, great staff, polite and up to date as to my needs. The staff was so courteous that they would help me with all my travels throughout, booking tickets for trains, taxis and flights. They were able to help me find the best deals to travel as well as serve my needs as best as possible in Amritsar. The hotel is so clean, and kept clean all throughout the day and night. I would walk into the Hotel at all odd hours of the night and day and would always have a staff greet me as well as see someone cleaning up. My room was always clean and beautifully decorated. The decoration is of a Luxury hotel from USA, as well as a very cozy feeling. This hotel has amazing Plasma Televisions and the most comfortable beds. For a traveler the SLEEP is the most valued, and the Beds and bedding made it so amazing to sleep in. This hotel always has hot water, even at 4am!! The bathrooms are decorated with the most adorable Towel elephants welcoming me to India! :) The bathrooms were also always fully stocked with clean towels and toilet paper!
reviews.title: great hotel ,but lady staff member tried to rip us off with taxi fair to airport

reviews.text: I stayed only one night. The hotel was really good. The staffs are really friendly. We arrived by hired taxi, but could not find the way to the hotel. When I called the hotel, a security man came to pick us up.
reviews.title: good choice for golden temple

reviews.text: It was really hot in Amritsar, so we just ate at the hotel. The food was good and the restaurant had a nice view of the busy old city street. Hotel room was clean and comfortable. All the staffs are kind and helpful. We had an extra bed which costs 300rupees. It was good for us, but it looks bit too soft. So if you want to have a proper bed, it is better to book another room. We took toyota inova from the hotel to airport and it costs 850rupees which I felt bit expensive. (Indica around 600 or 650)
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: There are many shops around the hotel and it was 3 mins walk to golden temple. We arrived the golden temple around 7am on sunday, but too many people. so we could not see inside. If you do not want to queue, you should arrive much earlier. You should also bring something to cover your head.
reviews.title: Cleanliness Fantastic

reviews.text: We also went to Wagah border, but I was not so impressed. I think if you are indian, maybe you enjoy more. The wagah border toilet was soooo horrible. It is better not to use toilet there.
reviews.title: Exactly as the picture, Great Communication prior to arrival

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: anyway, if I go back to Amirtsar, I will agin stay this hotel.
reviews.title: This is THE place to stay in Amritsar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent value at only Rs2200+tax for deluxe - large room, comfortable bed, decent shower, clean, air-con (and generator which is very necessary given frequent local power cuts). A torch is useful for the windowless stairs if power is out during the day and they are not running the generator!
reviews.title: Good choice but avoid overpriced travel desk

reviews.text: Great location for the Golden Temple. One way streets can make it a bit awkward to get to on arrival especially if your driver doesn't know the town (we came from chandigargh).
reviews.title: Excellent location and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wagah border ceremony is a must but hotel travel desk is overpriced - especially for cars to the airport. If you turn left out of the hotel and walk a short distance up the road there is a tour agency at the car park with much better prices.
reviews.title: Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked 2 deluxe rooms in this hotel. The hotel is excellent value for money. The rooms are good and clean. The hotel has a generator and hence frequent electricity cuts were not an issue in the hot weather of amritsar. The location is excellent as it is next to golden temple and jalianwala baug. We took the rooms at the rear and hence there was no noise. The cafe/ restaurant in the hotel is cute but the service is slow. The food in the hotel was average.
reviews.title: Great Experience

reviews.text: The travel desk at the hotel was co-operative and we hired a vehicle for our onward trip to manali. The vehicle was in good condition and the driver was good too.
reviews.title: An excellent choice
